title: British tourist breaks back in Ibiza
text:
British tourist breaks back in Ibiza   
Aug 30, 2015 eTN   
IBIZA, Spain - Sean Paul McCabe has already endured a five hour operation to reduce pressure on his damaged spine and faces a further 12 hours in surgery to repair the damage. 
A 20-year-old man is in intensive care in Ibiza after jumping head first into the shallow end of a swimming pool and breaking his back in two places. 
Sean Paul McCabe has already endured a five hour operation to reduce pressure on his damaged spine and faces a further 12 hours in surgery to repair the damage. 
His distraught dad, Gerard, told Belfast Live : “He was supposed to be back today and instead he is lying in a hospital bed with tubes and wires coming out of him.” 
Mr McCabe, of West Belfast, is now appealing for help in finding accommodation on the holiday island as his son recovers from the devastating injury. 
“It was a last minute holiday and Gerard forgot to book insurance,” he continued. 
“One of his friends pulled out at the last minute and Gerard took his place so they did a name change and he flew out last Sunday and had the accident on Wednesday. 
“Boys being boys they had been out all night and were at the swimming pool the next day. 
“Gerard jumped straight in and didn’t realize it was the shallow end. The first we heard of it was when one of Gerard’s friends texted his girlfriend to say he had broken his neck and she contacted us. 
“Then they texted to say he had just winded himself but Gerard said he knew himself something wasn’t right. It turned out he had broken his back in two places.” 
Mr McCabe and his wife, Edith, booked flights to Ibiza as soon as they heard the news and arrived last Thursday. 
“It was very hard to see Gerard in the hospital bed, it was very emotional,” said Mr McCabe. 
“We just wanted to get out to him. The doctor has told us Gerard was minutes away from being paralyzed because the swelling was so bad around his spine. 
“He is very upset and is intensive care, he is crying on and off because of the pain. 
“The hospital has been great but there is only so much morphine they can give him. 
“Everything is so expensive out here, apartments we have looked at cost 200 Euros a night so we’re hoping someone will rent us somewhere for the next four or five weeks while Gerard goes through his operation and starts his recovery.” 
Mr McCabe’s accident comes weeks after the father of a man who died suddenly in Ibiza issued a warning to young people travelling to the party island. 
Alan Drennan from Newtownabbey was found dead in his hotel room on July 19. He had only arrived on the Spanish island for a holiday the day before.
